TextView.android:text: 'Automatic mode' will enable and disable wifi when (and only when) you enter and leave the remembered wifi zones. You can still enable/disable wifi using wifi settings on the phone or your favourite power widget - this will last until you next leave/enter a remembered zone.

The location of known connections is remembered automatically when you connect to an access point. Just enable wifi manually, connect to a zone, and it will appear in the list (use the 'Reload' option if not).

This app DOES NOT use GPS or polling for access points. Because it uses cell-tower location, you may need to be about 1km (1-2miles) outside the defined zone before it will deactivate wifi. Using GPS or polling would reduce or negate any benefit to battery life. Because of this some unusual locations may be plotted - it's best not to delete them as they represent 'home' according to the cell-tower location.
Tap a network name to edit the size of the zone(s) in which it is active. Locations are approximate. The red zone shows your current estimated location.
Please email me if you need support: support@longhome.co.uk. The support menu button will also attach a useful log file.
